markdownContent: You return upstairs to a quiet desk and open Warren's book to a random page. With Amy Stanley's exortation to “archival excavation” in mind, you read a paragraph from a chapter called “Human Traffic and Brothel Prostitution”, and try to imagine what kind of archives might allow you to reconstruct the transitory lives of the women stowed away between Japan and Southeast Asia in the late-nineteenth century. Make some notes in the box below: they will be saved to your Notebook when you press “Continue”.
